page.title: 07RIVINGTON PIKE
page.content: Apart from Winter Hill mast the most dominating feature in our area is the squat tower atop the knoll at the head of Rivington Pike. The hill itself is a harder kernal of rock pushing its way above the beneral level of the gritstone moorland to a height of 361 metres. Local tradition believes that this could well have been one of the many beacon hills which was prepared for use at the time of the Armarda. The local gentry at Rivington Hall in the eighteenth century were the Andrews family and it seems that they hunted on the moors like many folk before them.
